conclusion: Need to analyze the paths from points A, B, C, and D to determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into.
A is connected to a yellow bar.
The yellow bar is positioned above the white container (E).
Liquid from A will flow directly into container E.
B is connected to a cyan bar.
The cyan bar is positioned above the blue container (F).
Liquid from B will flow directly into container F.
C is connected to a blue bar.
The blue bar is positioned above the blue container (F).
Liquid from C will flow directly into container F.
D is connected to a light blue bar.
The light blue bar is positioned above the blue container (F).
Liquid from D will flow directly into container F.
Liquid from A will flow into container E, and liquids from B, C, and D will flow into container F.
Container E will receive liquid from A, and container F will receive liquid from B, C, and D.
